page.description: Appends array(s) values to current array, but first applies a filter.
page.syntax: New_Array as P = append_arrays(P array1 , C filter1,[,P array2,C filter2,[,P arrayN,C filter3]])

argument.name: New_Array
argument.description: The new array produced by appending Array2 to Array1.

argument.name: filter1
argument.description: A character filter expression that selects elements from Array1.

argument.name: filter2
argument.description: A character filter expression that selects elements from Array2.

page.discussion: The <ARRAY>.APPEND_ARRAYS_FILTERED() method selects elements from Array2 and Array1 and merges them to produce New_Array. Both Array1 and Array2 must have a single dimension and have the same structure.
page.example: dim cars[10] as P cars.initialize_properties("manufacturer|model",<<%str% Ford|Taurus Ford|Focus GM|Malibu Dodge|Status %str%) dim trucks[10] as P trucks.initialize_properties("manufacturer|model",<<%str% Ford|F-150 Ford|Ranger Dodge|Dakota %str%) dim vehicles[2] as P vehicles.append_arrays_filtered(cars,"manufacturer='Ford'",trucks,"manufacturer='Ford'") values = vehicles.dump_properties("manufacturer model") ui_dlg_box("show_array",<<%dlg% [.50,10index^||values] %dlg%)
